comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13

I dont like using mouse/trackpad while browsing web. So there should be a key on pressing which i should get many key transparent (key eg. 1,2,3) display  for each link so that i can directly jump to that link this feature will be very useful.And should also display other info when i press a key for a link like new tab etc...
My toshiba speech recognition software is good example of this. thank u mozilla...
keep up the good work.

Reproducible: Always
comments.author: santanpereira@gmail.com
comments.creator: santanpereira@gmail.com

comments.author: MatsPalmgren_bugz@use.startmail.com
comments.creator: MatsPalmgren_bugz@use.startmail.com
comments.text:
Seems like a niche feature probably better implemented as an add-on.
Did you search https://addons.mozilla.org/ to see if there is one?
How about this one for example:
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/my-keyboard-navigator/
comments.raw_text:
Seems like a niche feature probably better implemented as an add-on.
Did you search https://addons.mozilla.org/ to see if there is one?
How about this one for example:
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/my-keyboard-navigator/
Or press ' (quote), then the first few characters of you link. Now you're using a find that will only search links.
comments.text: Or press ' (quote), then the first few characters of you link. Now you're using a find that will only search links.
comments.author: jo.hermans@gmail.com
comments.creator: jo.hermans@gmail.com
deletesoftware+moz@yandex.ru
comments.author: deletesoftware+moz@yandex.ru
comments.text: There is also Vimperator https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/vimperator/ , and an extension whose description says it is a fork of Vimperator: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/pentadactyl/
comments.raw_text: There is also Vimperator https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/vimperator/ , and an extension whose description says it is a fork of Vimperator: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/pentadactyl/
